memberdef.name: LV_LL_READ
memberdef.initializer: for(i = lv_ll_get_head(&list); i != NULL; i = lv_ll_get_next(&list, i))

memberdef.name: LV_LL_READ_BACK
memberdef.initializer: for(i = lv_ll_get_tail(&list); i != NULL; i = lv_ll_get_prev(&list, i))

detaileddescription.para:
Initialize linked list
ll_dsc
pointer to ll_dsc variable
node_size
the size of 1 node in bytes

Add a new head to a linked list
ll_p
pointer to linked list
pointer to the new head

Insert a new node in front of the n_act node
ll_p
pointer to linked list
n_act
pointer a node
pointer to the new head

Add a new tail to a linked list
ll_p
pointer to linked list
pointer to the new tail

Remove the node 'node_p' from 'll_p' linked list. It does not free the the memory of node.
ll_p
pointer to the linked list of 'node_p'
node_p
pointer to node in 'll_p' linked list

Remove and free all elements from a linked list. The list remain valid but become empty.
ll_p
pointer to linked list

Move a node to a new linked list
ll_ori_p
pointer to the original (old) linked list
ll_new_p
pointer to the new linked list
node
pointer to a node
head
true: be the head in the new list false be the head in the new list

Return with head node of the linked list
ll_p
pointer to linked list
pointer to the head of 'll_p'

Return with tail node of the linked list
ll_p
pointer to linked list
pointer to the head of 'll_p'

Return with the pointer of the next node after 'n_act'
ll_p
pointer to linked list
n_act
pointer a node
pointer to the next node

Return with the pointer of the previous node after 'n_act'
ll_p
pointer to linked list
n_act
pointer a node
pointer to the previous node

Return the length of the linked list.
ll_p
pointer to linked list
length of the linked list

Move a nodw before an other node in the same linked list
ll_p
pointer to a linked list
n_act
pointer to node to move
n_after
pointer to a node which should be after n_act

Check if a linked list is empty
ll_p
pointer to a linked list
true: the linked list is empty; false: not empty
